Text: (Lady Karen's remains do not exist.)

(All that is here is a fancy gravestone that I had
made by Mitsugoshi, meant to honor her life.)

(...And just as with Lady Karen, Sergey Gorman's
remains are not here either.)

...I, Annerose Nichtsehen, one of
Velgalta's Seven Bladesâ€”

Officially commence this funeral ceremony by the
Velgalta Empire, hereby restoring the good name
of Karen von Herzog!
...Lower the casket! Present arms!
Present arms!

(Lady Karen... With the truth of Sergey's atrocities
now revealed, your honor as an aristocrat and knight
have now been formally restored.)

(But...I was not able to deliver justice to Sergey
with my own handâ€”)

The Empire issued an official order to seize Sergey,
but by the time I tracked him to Madlid, it was all
overâ€”

All that remained was a circle gouged out of the
earth by some dreadful power, Sergey's shattered
sword, and shards of armor.
It was obvious that someone had slain Sergey.

But there wasn't even a shred of evidence to indicate
who was responsible...
...A moment of silence!

(As a result, I was unable to do anything in my role
as a dark knight.)

(And regardless of who slew Sergey, I wonder if
I would've been able to defeat him in such an
overwhelming manner.)

(...Confronted by this grim truth, I have to ask,
does my status as one of Velgalta's Seven Blades
mean anything?)
(I'm still so inept.)

(In terms of my skill with the sword and the path I
walk in hopes of putting my abilities to use, I'm
nothing more than a novice, ignorant of anything
and everything.)

...Lady Karen, as I am now, I cannot shoulder the
honor I have inherited from you.

Thus, I will relinquish my status as one of the Seven
Blades and embark upon a journey of training, honing
my swordplay and learning more of the world.

I pray that you will keep a watchful eye from the
other world as I, Annerose Nichtsehen, conduct
my travels!
...And so I bid you farewell!
Does it feel kinda weird?
...Yeah.

But it's also refreshing. Even though I had to
deceive her to accomplish our goals.

I don't know. It feels like I've fully cast off my
old identity and been reborn as a new me.
A new you... No. 111, or should I say, "Chi"?
And that would make you "Omega", hm?

Ugh, even after how far I've come, I still have to be
reminded that we all have ranks in an organization,
huh...

Oh, quit whining. What it means is that both you and
I were recognized for our work in Velgalta.

All of us Numbers are on equal footing, you know.
Maybe now we can get to know Lambda better too.
Who knows?
What's the matter?

...It's just that I doubted in my mind that the Shadow
Garden could truly change the world.

I'd say it was more than just in your mind.
Otherwise, you wouldn't go around with
such an attitude.

But the Shadow Garden is strong and smart. They're
merciless towards their enemies, and can be cunning.

And above all, there's Master Shadow... When I first
witnessed his power, my entire body shuddered
with fear and aweâ€”as if he's all that matters.
Did he frighten you?

...Yeah. And honestly, he still does. How naive I was
in my ignorance back then is equally as scary.
That's a good thing.
A good thing?

First off, Omega, what you've been lacking is
humility in the face those who possess great
power.

So...going forward, you need to behave with a little
more respect towards the Seven Shadows and your
comrades in arms.
...And towards you as well?

Exactly. I'm "Chi", one of the Numbers. And I'm your,
that is, "Omega's" partner, understand?

(I hope fortune favors you in the days to come too,
Annerose...)
